title: CHARLI3 FIDA SYNGENTA: Cardano Insurance w/ 3M Farmers
summary: Syngenta has a network of 3M+ farmers who lack insurance to protect against financial loss due to severe weather.
solution: Cardano weather insurance gives Syngenta’s small farmers affordable coverage. Fida Finance issues on-chain policies, funded by Cardano users, while Charli3 oracles verify weather for fast payouts.
proposer_relevant_experience:
FIDA: Entire team



    Lead: [https://www\.linkedin\.com/in/rodolfohansen/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/rodolfohansen/)

    Leadership team

    Development team, smart contract and front end/ full stack

    Business development



CHARLI3: Entire team



    Charli3 brings a robust team of developers with a proven track record



Project lead:



Robert Hever



Business Development:



Damon Zwarich



Technical advisors on our team that may be involved

Founder of Steelswap.io ([https://x\.com/ElderM\)](https://x.com/ElderM))



Current contractors who may join the project:



    Metalamp (Currently engaged)

    Txpipe (Working on complimentary project)



In-house Development team:



Talha Hussain



Deep Bhatt



Jose Seraquive



We will hire inhouse team members dedicated to this project, including a senior architect.



In addition to the in-house team assigned to this project, we will likely hire a technical project lead and full-stack developer. We have two in mind from our working relationship with Metalamp.

sub_fields.title: Describe your established collaborations.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale for your established collaborations.
sub_fields.answer:
**Charli3**, **Fida**, and **Syngenta** are all strategically relevant partners for executing this project.

Each contributing a specialized layer essential for building Cardano Insurance and onboarding farmers as active policy holders.

Summary: Syngenta brings deep expertise and 3M+ farmers (policy holders). Fida builds the onchain cardano insurance policies, funding mechanism, and policy payout functionality. Charli3 integrates and monitors data sources to settle insurance policies enabling automated payment.



Charli3 and Fida have a public record of collaboration including our project proposal from F13: [https://projectcatalyst\.io/funds/13/cardano\-partners\-enterprise\-randd/charli3\-fida\-howden\-automated\-parametric\-insurance\-using\-cardano\-blockchain](https://projectcatalyst.io/funds/13/cardano-partners-enterprise-randd/charli3-fida-howden-automated-parametric-insurance-using-cardano-blockchain)





**Syngenta Group \- “Tier 1 partner”**

- Revenue: $28 billion in sales in 2024 - [https://www\.syngentagroup\.com/newsroom/2025/fyr\-2024](https://www.syngentagroup.com/newsroom/2025/fyr-2024)
- Specific team: Syngenta Foundation for Sustainable Agriculture (SFSA) and their Indian team ([https://sf\-india\.in/about/\)](https://sf-india.in/about/))
- Expertise: Deep, long-standing expertise in sustainable agriculture, smallholder farmer development, and emerging market financial inclusion.
- **Key project contribution: **their Agri-Entrepreneur (AE) Program ([https://sf\-india\.in/get\-involved/\),,\)](https://sf-india.in/get-involved/),,)) a massive existing network of over 21,000 local entrepreneurs who serve millions of farmers. This network provides the last mile access necessary to onboard farmers, verify land parcels, facilitate digital enrollment, and provide localized support and training.
- The Syngenta team is already working with Cardano projects and are in the process of onboarding farmers for other services: [https://projectcatalyst\.io/funds/13/cardano\-partners\-enterprise\-randd/syngenta\-agricultural\-insight\-and\-earth\-observation\-data\-uplifts\-subsistence\-farmers\-into\-profitability](https://projectcatalyst.io/funds/13/cardano-partners-enterprise-randd/syngenta-agricultural-insight-and-earth-observation-data-uplifts-subsistence-farmers-into-profitability)
- Additional value add: the satellite data for the other F13 project can be leveraged as source data for this project to settle insurance policies.
- **Project Deliverables: **
    - Insurance Policy adoption: Face-to-face onboarding of farmers through their Agri Entrepreneurs driving adoption and connecting the blockchain solution to real businesses and people.
    - Advisory:the off-chain integration partner, ensuring the blockchain solution is practical, adopted, and relevant to the farmers' needs. They reduce project risk by providing a validated, scaled distribution channel.

**FIDA Finance \([https://fida\.finance/\)](https://fida.finance/)\) “Insurance protocol expert”**

- FIDA is the on-chain financial layer, transforming climate risk into a liquid, tradable asset (ILS NFTs/Fida Cards) that can be backed by global investors.
- Insurance specialists with deep in-house technical skills required for Cardano development
- Led by [https://www\.linkedin\.com/in/rodolfohansen/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/rodolfohansen/)
- Expertise: Building decentralized financial platforms and risk transfer mechanisms on blockchain technology, specifically within the Cardano ecosystem. The team deployed a Cardano native decentralized insurance solution.
- **Key project contribution: **FIDA is the Decentralized Risk Transfer Protocol partner, providing the core DeFi technology layer. The FIDA Risk Transfer Protocol. This protocol is the smart contract architecture that enables the creation of Peer-to-Peer (P2P) financial contracts. It manages the pooling of investor collateral (liquidity), processes the farmer's payment, and handles the automated, immutable fund disbursement upon contract activation.





**CHARLI3 Oracles \(charli3\.io\) \- “Data Experts and Cardano OGs”**

- Cardano’s first decentralized oracle solution
- Project manager: [https://www\.linkedin\.com/in/robhever/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/robhever/)
- Charli3 began building on Cardano in 2021 with the same core team delivering 11/11 project catalyst projects. We are one of the oldest projects on Cardano with a deep network of partnerships with technical labs to overcome any challenge.
- Expertise: Web3 data delivery specialists. Deployed an oracle network on mainnet in 2022 and has run with 99.99999% uptime since that time. Deployed multiple other mainnet solutions: push and pull oracles, proof of reserve, validation oracles, DEX aggregator solution, DEX aggregated token price API solution, and created the first Cardano partnerchain integrated with Cardano in 2025.
- Key project contribution: A dedicated Earth Observation (EO) Oracle network. This network securely gathers, aggregates, and verifies objective satellite data (e.g., rainfall, vegetative index) related to the farmers' land parcels. CHARLI3 acts as the trigger mechanism for the parametric financial contracts (Cardano insurance policies). Their data eliminates manual loss assessment, ensuring that when a predefined negative weather event occurs, the verified data instantly activates the FIDA smart contract for automated payout.

sub_fields.title: Describe funding commitments.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale for your funding commitments.
sub_fields.answer:
FIDA Protocol Adaptation & Smart Contracts	40% - 50%	Development, auditing, and deployment of the risk transfer smart contracts on Cardano, and the front-end UI/UX for the Agri-Entrepreneurs (AEs).

CHARLI3 Oracle Integration	20% - 30%	Building the secure, verifiable Oracle feed pipeline from the Earth Observation (EO) data source into the Cardano blockchain, focused on required agricultural metrics.

SFSA AE System Integration	10% - 20%	Technical work to integrate the FIDA smart contract interface and data layers with the existing SFSA Agri-Entrepreneur Digital Diary (AEDD) application.

Syngenta will supply additional resources in the form of Agri Entrepreneur time to onboard farmers. Although some portion will go to tasks complementary, an unknown committment of funding may be supplied in the future.

sub_fields.title: Describe your key performance metrics.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale for your key performance metrics.
sub_fields.answer:
**Important Measures of Success:**

1. **Number of on\-chain transactions**. Each oracle update and insurance policy will increase Cardano on-chain activity.
2. **TVL**: Insurance policies are backed by funds on Cardano (ADA, USDM, etc.). More insurance policies means more TVL.
3. **Adoption**: number of farmers protected by policies using Cardano insurance is a marketing opportunity for the chain

Conservative short term post project goals

- 100,000+ transactions
- TVL USD$5,000,000
- 1,000 farmers onboard



**General Deliverables**

**FIDA Risk Transfer Protocol Adaptation:** Successful deployment and testing of FIDA's protocol on Cardano to support smallholder parametric contracts.

**Oracle EO Oracle Feed:** A dedicated, verified **Oracle feed** delivering specific agricultural weather metrics (derived from Earth Observation data) to the Cardano smart contracts.

**AE Program Integration:** A functional integration module that allows SFSA's **Agri\-Entrepreneurs** to enroll farmers and monitor their financial protection contracts via the fida web dApp.

**Program Report** A program with a target group of farmers in the SFSA network, resulting in a public report detailing the speed and accuracy of automated financial disbursements.

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
**TL;DR**

**Syngenta brings the farmers\. Fida builds the system\. Charli3 brings the data\.**

Insurance policies are converted into smart contracts and data is provided be decentralized oracle networks to trigger payouts. Cardano users can stake funds to earn yield while payouts to policyholders are taken from staked funds. Instead of traditional insurance, when frost destroys a farm’s yield, that farmer can see a payout on the same day. With Syngenta’s 3M farmers, the value goes a step further to provide protection against those events – protection that they’ve never had access to before this project.







**The solution has three main parts:**

1. Database of Policies
2. Real World Data Verification System designed by Charli3 Oracles
3. Risk Transfer Platform designed by Fida Finance

**1 \- Database of Policies**

The first task for the team is to create or define policies from their standard format (e.g. frost damage insurance for farmers) into configurations ready to determine the operations of both oracle networks and the Risk Transfer Platform.

Parametric Insurance Policy → Configuration file for blockchain oracle network setup

This is one of the few parts of the process that will remain manual at this time. A configuration file for a blockchain oracle determines parameters such as data sources, triggers for updating data on-chain (e.g. such as price deviation), regular heartbeat update intervals, number of nodes, and so on.

Parametric Insurance Policy → Smart Contract Logic for the Risk Transfer Platform

Likewise, the Fida Finance team needs to define the exact parameters and threshold values for triggering policy payouts. These will inform the creation of smart contracts and allow configuration of smart contract logic for each policy. Each policy will have a corresponding smart contract that triggers upon receiving the right data and that causes an automated payout in ADA (or USDM or fiat if we can implement these solutions in time). Converting policies into smart contracts is likely a manual process for this project, but can be automated in the future to enable rapid scaling. It is important to note that architecture and processes for this step are already built and Fida will be customizing a solution based on what already exists to deliver this project.

The project team will need to build a reliable back-end database solution to store this information, it will become the source of truth for both the Data Verification and the Risk Transfer Platform. We will consider an entirely on-chain solution if feasible.

**2 \- Parametric Insurance Data Verification System**

Second, Charli3 Oracles will design and build a Parametric Insurance Data Verification System (PID System) that is optimized specifically for this use-case and driven by Charli3’s enshrined blockchain oracle networks.

**About Charli3 Oracles**

- Charli3 Oracles is the first decentralized enshrined oracle solution on Cardano. The first live data feeds on mainnet launched in 2022. We specialize in delivering real world data onto the Cardano blockchain to be used as input in Decentralized Applications.
- 15,000+ hours of continuous Ecosystem uptime (100% uptime)
- 30,000+ successful updates on-chain
- 125,000+ successful node updates on-chain
- 4 distinct alert and monitoring systems to catch issues before they happen
- Plan to fully open source all solutions in 2026

**Configuration of Oracle Network**

The policies will be converted into configurations that direct the function of an oracle network. Oracle networks will be set up that monitor and deliver data on-chain for consumption by smart contracts. The architecture to do this already exists, but we will need to customize the datum onchain and integration with satellite oracle data from Syngenta. This customization is non-trivial.

**Data Monitoring**

Once an oracle network is configured and deployed, the first function of the system will be to monitor data sources in real-time (e.g. every 2 minutes). Since Nodes running the Charli3 Node Software already monitor deviations for price pairs, we can adapt this monitoring tool for different policies. There may be customizations to the current Charli3 Oracle architecture to optimize for this use-case that we’ve accounted for in the milestones and budget. Positive responses from the monitoring solution trigger the second part of the solution: data verification.

**Data Verification via Oracle Networks**

After the monitoring service (run by node operators, automated, and built into the node software) identifies a parameter threshold being met, it then triggers the oracle network assigned to verify the real world event by querying the data sources, aggregating the results, and passing it along to an on-chain (second processing step) aggregation contract.

Charli3 Oracles has an already built and tested system to do all of this work: [https://docs\.charli3\.io/oracles/products/pull\-oracle/infrastructure\.](https://docs.charli3.io/oracles/products/pull-oracle/infrastructure.) It just needs to be optimized for the data sources, parameters, and expected on-chain value for Parametric Insurance policies. The final on-chain is the culmination of all the independent external node operators verifying multiple data sources and the Charli3 aggregation contract removing any outliers and nefarious node activity. This on-chain data becomes input for the third part of the system, the Risk Transfer Platform.

The expectation is that a single Oracle Network will service multiple policies, but we will likely need to create many networks to scale the service. We will determine how to do this efficiently during the project architectural design phase.

**3 \- Risk Transfer Platform**

The function of the Risk Transfer Platform is to:

- consume values from the PID System
- trigger the automated claims approval process
- trigger the automated payout system
- act as an UI/UX for customers to check statuses of claims
- Leveraging Cardano’s smart contract functionality and Fida’s knowledge of converting policies into on-chain smart contracts, the Risk Transfer Platform is an end-to-end solution for automating Parametric Insurance. While significant challenges with the current way parametric insurance is executed by integrating with a blockchain oracle solution, the adoption of smart contract functionality on Cardano, to execute the approval and payout process, is essential to solving the challenges we address in the previous section.

**Integration with PID System**

For this project, Fida will drive the design of this platform by translating parametric insurance policies into smart contracts with specific logic. An integration between the PID System may also be necessary to identify what specific feed values trigger which particular policies. There are different ways that we can integrate the two parts of the solution and will research which is the best option during the design phase in milestone 1. There have been discussions of a bitmap on-chain, but more research is required to settle on the right solution here.

**Risk Transfer Back\-end and On\-Chain Setup**

The core function of the platform is to identify the right policies when a verified parameter is satisfied, then automate the claims approval and payout process. After receiving a triggering event from the PID system driven by Charli3 Oracles, the Risk Transfer back-end is a set of smart contracts that ensure that the specific policies triggered automatically lead to the right payouts. For this project POC, we will payout in ADA and likely on testnet to conserve funds. We will provide a report at the end of the project to describe the implementation of a live customer solution where payment may occur in fiat too (optional: if possible we may implement fiat or USDM for the project).

**Risk Transfer Platform Operation**

Once smart contracts are configured, then the process between the PID System and payout should be seamless and automatic. The Fida team will construct a payment mechanism that gets triggered by the policy smart contracts. For the MVP, this may simply be an ADA payment to a crypto wallet or, if possible, a USDM or fiat ramp to a bank account of a policyholder.

**Risk Transfer UI/UX**

In addition to automating Parametric Insurance, we will create a front-end. Prospective policy-holders can view policies and buy policies. While policy-holders can view and manage current policies. The exact design and functionality of the front-end will be determined in the design phase of the project. At the very least, the project will have a front-end that allows viewing and basic management of policies.







NOTE: 

This project is an adaption of a previously submitted F13 proposal where Fida and Charli3 were partnering with the Howden Group: ([https://projectcatalyst\.io/funds/13/cardano\-partners\-enterprise\-randd/charli3\-fida\-howden\-automated\-parametric\-insurance\-using\-cardano\-blockchain\)\)\)\)](https://projectcatalyst.io/funds/13/cardano-partners-enterprise-randd/charli3-fida-howden-automated-parametric-insurance-using-cardano-blockchain)))))



**Key Changes:**

- Howden group is no longer involved
- Policies are not provided by Howden
- Syngenta replaces Howden Group
- Syngenta provides 3M farmers as potential policy holders
- Premiums (funds to back insurance policies) can be provided by any Cardano user providing yield opportunities and potential for very large TVL if institutional investors or insurance companies participate via USDM, BTC, ADA, or etc.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
Value to the community:

```
Massive Increase in On-Chain Activity and Transactions
```
Benefit: A large insurance company integrating with Cardano would result in substantial on-chain activity due to the automation of claims, payments, policy management, and data recording. This would lead to a significant increase in the volume of transactions on the blockchain.

Impact on Cardano:

```
Higher transaction volume would increase the utility and demand for ADA, the native cryptocurrency, potentially boosting its value.

More on-chain activity would contribute to higher transaction fees collected by validators and delegators, incentivizing network participation and improving the security of the blockchain.

It could also stimulate the development of Layer 2 solutions to handle increased traffic, further expanding Cardano’s scalability and technology stack.
```
1. Strengthening Cardano's Position in the Real-World Finance Sector

Benefit: Integrating a high-revenue insurance company would help establish Cardano as a significant player in the traditional finance and insurance industries. This kind of adoption would showcase Cardano's ability to handle large-scale, real-world applications.

Impact on Cardano:

```
It would enhance Cardano’s reputation and credibility, attracting more businesses and institutions to explore blockchain technology for their operations.

Positioning Cardano as a leader in enterprise blockchain solutions could lead to further partnerships in finance, banking, and other traditional sectors.

Regulatory recognition could increase as governments and regulatory bodies take notice of the blockchain's role in managing significant financial flows, potentially leading to more favorable regulatory treatment.
```
1. Improved Ecosystem Development and Innovation

Benefit: The integration of a large insurance company would likely drive innovation within the Cardano ecosystem, encouraging developers to create new decentralized applications (dApps), smart contracts, and services to support insurance use cases.

Impact on Cardano:

```
The ecosystem could see the emergence of a variety of applications, such as parametric insurance platforms, risk assessment tools, and decentralized reinsurance solutions.

Increased funding and resources for development could be directed towards ecosystem projects, with incentives for developers to build tools, SDKs, and solutions that cater to insurance-related requirements.

This could foster a diverse range of DeFi (Decentralized Finance) products built on Cardano, leveraging insurance-related data to offer innovative financial instruments or staking models.
```
1. Expanding Cardano's DeFi and Stablecoin Ecosystem (USDM/USDA)

Benefit: With an insurance company using Cardano, there could be new demand for DeFi services and stablecoin integrations, such as for holding premiums, issuing payouts, or managing policyholder funds.

Impact on Cardano:

```
The introduction of stablecoins backed by the insurance company could provide more liquidity to the Cardano ecosystem, boosting DeFi protocols and lending platforms.

The insurance company could facilitate the creation of new financial products, such as tokenized insurance policies or reinsurance pools, which would diversify and deepen Cardano's DeFi landscape.

Policyholders could be incentivized to interact with Cardano’s DeFi ecosystem, such as by staking their insurance payouts or using DeFi services to grow their wealth.
```
1. Enhancing Data and Oracle Solutions (CHARLI3)

Benefit: Integrating an insurance company would involve real-world data sources, such as weather data for parametric insurance, healthcare data for health insurance, or logistics data for shipping insurance. This would create a need for innovation of robust oracle solutions.

Impact on Cardano:

```
It could accelerate the development and adoption of oracle services within the Cardano ecosystem, helping to improve data feeds for other applications.

Reliable and decentralized oracle networks would improve, which would also benefit other sectors that rely on real-world data, such as supply chain management, gaming, and IoT.

The demand for verified data from multiple sources could highlight the security of enshrined oracle systems, further enhancing Cardano’s capability for data-driven smart contract
```




Lastly, Cardano users get access to yield opportunities that support a real world use-case helping farmers in rural areas protect their business and this could drive TVL through insurance premiums locked in the protocol. It may even attract large institutional investors such as insurance companies to onboard onto Cardano.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
**Syngenta Group** is a tier 1 company with **28billion in sales** last year. The group has pre-established connections with the farmers in the project. Moreover there are already connections with Cardano established through the F13 project: [https://projectcatalyst\.io/funds/13/cardano\-partners\-enterprise\-randd/syngenta\-agricultural\-insight\-and\-earth\-observation\-data\-uplifts\-subsistence\-farmers\-into\-profitability](https://projectcatalyst.io/funds/13/cardano-partners-enterprise-randd/syngenta-agricultural-insight-and-earth-observation-data-uplifts-subsistence-farmers-into-profitability) . The community can trust Syngenta has the best chance of onboarding farmers into Cardano Insurance through their boots-on-the-ground 21,000 Agri Entrepreneur team already well positioned to sell and onboard farmers who necessarily would not have access to insurance products.

**Fida\.finance** has one singular focus as a business: create decentralized insurance on Cardano. Led by [https://www\.linkedin\.com/in/rodolfohansen/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/rodolfohansen/) the team have dedicated several years to this mission. In this regard, they have deep understanding of technical development on Cardano as well as what it will take to deliver an end-to-end insurance solution. The next step for Fida is leveraging the pre-built architecture to onboard users, such as the 3M farmers accessible through Syngenta.

**Charli3 Oracles** is a team building on Cardano since 2021 with 100% catalyst project completion rates with 11 projects completed to date. This makes us ideal project managers to ensure every milestone is hit and on track. Charli3 launched one of the first smart contracts on Cardano and we're the first decentralized oracle solution live on Cardano. We have an in-house development team with members that joined in 2021. Our core team have been with the company long-term and through a difficult bear market together. We have working relationships with every Cardano entity, most major labs, and are actively participating in the Cardano development community so we are always on the forefront of all technical innovations. We don't depend outside teams. Our network delivers our success rate.

sub_fields.answer:

1. Data Verification System MVP completed
    1. Mock data source completed
    2. Monitors and verifies from mock data source
2. Risk Transfer Platform completed
    1. Smart contract logic for a single policy completed
    2. Risk Rating calculations and simulations
    3. Simple payout solution completed
    4. Successful demonstration of monitoring a mock data source, triggering verification, communicating with the Risk Transfer Platform and executing the right ADA payment to a wallet per policy
3. Demo Video created

sub_fields.answer:

- Completed Mock data source and github repo to view it
- Calling data source and getting a response
- Policy details and shows database design (expected results shown)
- Smart contract details including mock customer info with destination wallet
- End-to-end test showing the mock data source triggering an automated payment to the destination wallet on Cardano testnet (showing expected results)

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
The value for money (VFM) of this proposal for the Project Catalyst Community lies in its unique combination of leveraging of existing infrastructure, and making it exist on the Cardano Blockchain, which for the first time allows us to insure the uninsured and get them fast remediation promising long-term growth for the Cardano ecosystem.



It Offers High Impact & Real-World Utility (The "Value")



This project directly addresses one of the most significant and urgent challenges in the developing world: providing financial security against climate risk to the financially excluded.



Solving a Global Problem: The proposal delivers a solution—automated, parametric financial protection—to smallholder farmers who lack access to reliable traditional financial services. This addresses financial exclusion and climate vulnerability head-on.



Massive, Validated User Base: The project is not starting from scratch. It directly integrates with the Syngenta Foundation's Agri-Entrepreneur (AE) program, which already operates a verified, trusted, last-mile network of over 21,000 AEs serving 2.3 million farmers across India. This guarantees immediate, high-volume exposure and impact for a Cardano-based solution.



Foundation for Future DeFi: By leveraging CHARLI3 for verifiable Earth Observation (EO) data, the project establishes a fundamental primitive: a verifiable digital identity for land parcels. This single, trustless data layer serves as the foundation for a suite of future on-chain services, including credit scoring, sustainable certification, and more complex lending/DeFi products.



It can accomplish this because we will use of the established SFSA network dramatically reduces the cost and risk typically associated with deploying grassroots technology solutions in emerging markets.



Leveraging Existing Infrastructure: The proposal avoids the massive expenditure required to build a distribution, training, and trust network. It integrates directly with the Agri-Entrepreneur Digital Diary (AEDD) application —a system already in use by the AEs. This strategy minimizes development costs and maximizes adoption by fitting the solution into an existing, proven workflow.



Reduced Implementation Risk: The Syngenta Foundation provides the critical human layer of validation and support. The AEs act as trusted intermediaries, mitigating the risk of user error, technical illiteracy, and data disputes in rural areas. This dramatically improves the chance of the technology achieving real-world usage and success, ensuring the Catalyst funds are efficiently spent.



Automation for Scale: The reliance on parametric contracts and the CHARLI3 Oracle automates the most costly and slowest part of traditional financial protection: verification and disbursement. This eliminates the need for expensive manual loss adjusters and reduces administrative overhead, allowing the solution to scale cost-effectively across millions of farmers.



Finally, there is a Clear Scaling Pathway: The SFSA's long-term vision is to scale their network from the current 23,000 AEs to 100,000 AEs, reaching approximately 15 million smallholder farmers. A successful pilot using Catalyst funds positions Cardano as the default blockchain infrastructure for this expansion, securing millions of future users for the platform.
